course.description_en: Learn about family members and how families love and care for each other. Discover who is in your family and what makes families special.
course.description_ar: تعلم عن أفراد الأسرة وكيف تحب الأسر وتعتني ببعضها البعض. اكتشف من في أسرتك وما يجعل الأسر مميزة.
course.subject: social_studies

content_data.title: My Special Mommy Loves Me
content_data.content: This is my mommy. Mommy loves me very much. Mommy takes care of me every day. Mommy gives me hugs when I'm sad. Mommy feeds me yummy food. Mommy reads me stories at bedtime. Mommy helps me get dressed. Mommy plays with me. Mommy keeps me safe. Mommy has a warm smile. When mommy smiles, I feel happy. Mommy and I do fun things together. We sing songs. We play games. I love my mommy so much!
learning_objectives: Identify mommy as a family member
Understand how mommy cares for them
Express love for family members

vocabulary_words.definition: Special lady who loves you and takes care of you
Very strong happy feeling for someone special
Help and take good care of someone
Wrap arms around someone to show love
Happy look on face that shows joy
Protected and not in danger

materials_needed: Soft stuffed animal for hugging practice
content_data.parent_guidance: Point to yourself in family photos. Give child gentle hugs during the lesson. Ask child to show what mommy does (pretend to cook, read, etc.). Keep the focus positive and loving. Adapt language to fit your family structure.
safety_notes: Use only recent, safe family photos
Ensure mirror is unbreakable
Choose soft, clean stuffed animals
Keep activities calm and comforting
Be sensitive to different family structures
discussion_questions: Where is mommy in this picture?
What does mommy do to take care of you?
How does mommy make you feel?

extension_activities.title: Mommy and Me Drawing
extension_activities.description: Draw a simple picture of you and mommy together.

extension_activities.title: Thank You Mommy
extension_activities.description: Give mommy extra hugs and say 'thank you' for taking care of you.
materials: None needed - just hugs and words

content_data.title: My Wonderful Daddy Loves Me
content_data.content: This is my daddy. Daddy loves me very much too. Daddy plays with me. Daddy makes me laugh. Daddy gives me piggyback rides. Daddy reads me stories. Daddy helps me learn new things. Daddy keeps me safe. Daddy has strong arms for hugs. Daddy works hard for our family. When daddy comes home, I feel so happy! Daddy and I have fun together. We build with blocks. We go for walks. I love my daddy so much!
learning_objectives: Identify daddy as a family member
Understand how daddy cares for family
Recognize daddy's special role in family

vocabulary_words.definition: Special man who loves you and takes care of you
Happy sound you make when something is funny
Ride on someone's back for fun
Having power to lift and carry things
Do important jobs to help the family
Put things together to make something new

materials_needed: Building blocks or safe stacking toys
content_data.parent_guidance: Point to daddy in family photos. Let child practice 'building' with safe blocks. Demonstrate gentle hugs. If daddy is present, encourage interaction. Adapt content for single-parent families or different family structures.
safety_notes: Use large, safe building materials only
Ensure no small blocks that could be choking hazards
Keep activities appropriate for child's motor skills
Be inclusive of all family structures
Supervise all building activities
discussion_questions: What fun things do you do with daddy?
How does daddy help our family?
What makes daddy special?

extension_activities.title: Building Together
extension_activities.description: Build a simple tower with blocks like daddy might do.

extension_activities.title: Daddy Picture Story
extension_activities.description: Look at pictures and tell stories about fun times with daddy.

content_data.title: Siblings Are Special Family Members
content_data.content: Some families have brothers and sisters. Brothers and sisters are called siblings. Siblings can be older or younger. Older siblings help teach us things. Younger siblings look up to us. Sometimes siblings play together. Sometimes siblings share toys. Brothers and sisters love each other. They help each other. Let's pretend to be siblings! Take turns being the big sibling and little sibling. Big siblings are gentle helpers. Little siblings learn by watching. All siblings are special!
learning_objectives: Understand what brothers and sisters are
Learn about helping and sharing with siblings
Practice being gentle with others

vocabulary_words.definition: Boy who has the same mommy and daddy as you
Girl who has the same mommy and daddy as you
Brothers and sisters in your family
Born before you, bigger than you
Born after you, smaller than you
Let others use your toys too

materials_needed: Safe toys that can be shared
content_data.parent_guidance: Use dolls to demonstrate sibling relationships. If child has siblings, point them out in photos. If child is an only child, explain that some families have siblings and some don't. Practice gentle touch with dolls.
safety_notes: Choose soft, safe dolls appropriate for age
Ensure sharing toys are large enough to be safe
Supervise all pretend play
Be sensitive to only children
Teach gentle handling of dolls and toys
discussion_questions: Do you have brothers or sisters?
How can siblings help each other?
What can siblings do together?

extension_activities.title: Sibling Care Play
extension_activities.description: Practice being a gentle big sibling by caring for a doll or stuffed animal.

extension_activities.title: Sharing Practice
extension_activities.description: Practice sharing toys nicely, taking turns with different items.

content_data.title: Grandma and Grandpa Love Me So Much
content_data.content: Grandparents are very special people. Grandma is mommy's or daddy's mommy. Grandpa is mommy's or daddy's daddy. Grandparents have been around for a long time. They know many stories. Grandparents give the best hugs. They have time to play with us. Grandma might bake cookies. Grandpa might tell funny stories. Grandparents love to see us grow. They take pictures of us. Some grandparents live nearby. Some grandparents live far away. But they all love us very much!
learning_objectives: Identify grandparents as family members
Understand grandparents' special role
Learn that families can live in different places

vocabulary_words.definition: Mommy or daddy's mommy, very special older lady
Mommy or daddy's daddy, very special older man
Grandma and grandpa together
Fun tales about things that happened
Make yummy food like cookies in the oven
Get bigger and learn new things

content_data.parent_guidance: Show photos of grandparents if available. If grandparents have passed away or aren't present, focus on the concept gently. Let child hold pretend cookies. Read a short story together like grandparents might do.
safety_notes: Be sensitive to families without grandparents
Use only safe, large pretend food items
Choose age-appropriate books
Keep discussions positive and comforting
Adapt content for different family situations
discussion_questions: What do grandparents like to do?
How do grandparents show they love you?
What makes grandparents special?

extension_activities.title: Grandparent Letter or Drawing
extension_activities.description: Make a simple drawing or 'letter' to send to grandparents.

extension_activities.title: Story Time Like Grandparents
extension_activities.description: Sit together and 'read' books the way grandparents do.

content_data.title: Our Pet Friends Are Part of Our Family
content_data.content: Some families have pet animals. Pets are special family members too. Dogs are loyal family friends. They wag their tails when happy. Cats are soft and like to purr. Fish swim in their tanks. Birds sing pretty songs. Pets need love and care. We feed them every day. We give them fresh water. We pet them gently. We keep them safe and warm. Pets love us back. They make our family complete. Let's pretend to take care of pets!
learning_objectives: Understand pets can be family members
Learn how to care for pets gently
Practice being responsible and gentle

vocabulary_words.definition: Animals that live with families and are loved
Always loving and staying with family
Move tail back and forth when happy
Happy sound cats make when content
Soft and careful touch, not rough
Taking good care of someone or something

materials_needed: Small bowl for pretend pet food
content_data.parent_guidance: Use stuffed animals to demonstrate gentle pet care. Show how to 'feed' and 'water' pets. Practice gentle stroking motions. If family has real pets, supervise gentle interaction. If no pets, explain that not all families have pets and that's okay too.
safety_notes: Always supervise interactions with real pets
Teach gentle touch with stuffed animals first
Use only safe, clean stuffed animals
Keep pretend food items large and safe
Never leave child alone with real animals
discussion_questions: How do we take care of pets?
What do pets need to be happy?
How can we be gentle with animals?

extension_activities.title: Pet Care Routine
extension_activities.description: Create a daily routine for caring for stuffed animal 'pets'.

extension_activities.title: Animal Sounds Game
extension_activities.description: Make sounds that different pets make - barking, meowing, chirping.

content_data.title: How Families Show Love Every Day
content_data.content: Families show love in many ways. We hug each other tight. We say 'I love you' every day. We help each other when needed. We share our toys and snacks. We take care of each other when sick. We celebrate happy times together. We comfort each other when sad. Let's practice showing family love! Give gentle hugs. Say kind words. Help with simple tasks. Share something special. Use gentle touches. Families are full of love!
learning_objectives: Learn different ways families show love
Practice expressing love and care
Understand importance of helping family

vocabulary_words.definition: Very special caring feeling for family
Wrap arms around someone to show you care
Do things to make someone's job easier
Be happy together about good things
Make someone feel better when they're sad
Nice and caring words and actions

content_data.parent_guidance: Demonstrate each way of showing love. Practice hugs, kind words, and helping actions. Let child practice sharing snacks. Model comforting behaviors with stuffed animals. Make this lesson very interactive and positive.
safety_notes: Ensure all snacks are safe and age-appropriate
Keep hugging gentle and appropriate
Use clean tissues and materials
Supervise all sharing activities
Keep music at safe volume levels
discussion_questions: How does your family show love?
What can you do to help your family?
How do you feel when family hugs you?

extension_activities.title: Love Coupons
extension_activities.description: Make simple 'coupons' for hugs, help, or kind words to give family.

extension_activities.title: Family Helping Chart
extension_activities.description: Create a picture chart of ways child can help family.

content_data.title: What Do You Know About Families?
content_data.content: Let's play a fun family game! I will ask you questions about families. You can point to pictures, use actions, or tell me with words!
learning_objectives: Review family member roles and relationships
Practice identifying family members
Show understanding of family love and care

vocabulary_words.definition: Fun game with questions about what you learned
People who love you and live together or care for you

content_data.parent_guidance: Ask questions gently and give plenty of time for answers. Accept pointing, actions, or simple words. Celebrate every response. Use photos and props to help child answer. Keep it fun and pressure-free.
safety_notes: Keep quiz short and enjoyable
No pressure for perfect answers
Use encouraging tone throughout
Take breaks if child seems tired
discussion_questions: Who takes care of you every day?
Point to mommy and daddy in the picture!
What do grandparents like to do?
How do we take care of pets?
Show me how families hug!
What can you do to help your family?

extension_activities.title: Family Member Actions
extension_activities.description: Act out what different family members do (cook like mommy, read like daddy).

extension_activities.title: Family Photo Story
extension_activities.description: Tell stories about family photos and what everyone is doing.

content_data.title: Celebrating Our Special Family
content_data.content: Let's celebrate our wonderful family! Every family is special and unique. Some families are big. Some families are small. All families have love. Let's think about our family. Count your family members. Say their names. Think about what makes each person special. Mommy takes care of us. Daddy plays with us. Siblings share with us. Grandparents tell us stories. Pets give us cuddles. We are so lucky to have our family! Let's make a family cheer! 'Family, family, we love you! Family, family, we're here for you!' Our family is the best family for us!
learning_objectives: Celebrate and appreciate their own family
Understand all families are different and special
Express gratitude for family members

vocabulary_words.definition: Be very happy about something special
Special and different from others
Say numbers to see how many
Happy to have good things
Happy words we say together loudly
Being thankful for good things

materials_needed: All family photos used in previous lessons
Paper and crayons for family drawing
content_data.parent_guidance: Go through family photos together, naming each person and what makes them special. Help child create a family drawing or collage. Join in the family cheer enthusiastically. Take photos of this celebration if desired. Make it a truly joyful conclusion to learning about family.
safety_notes: Keep celebration positive and inclusive
Be sensitive to different family structures
Use safe art supplies only
Keep music at appropriate volume
Ensure all activities are age-appropriate
discussion_questions: What makes your family special?
Who is your favorite person to play with?
How does your family make you feel?

extension_activities.title: Family Portrait Creation
extension_activities.description: Draw or create a family portrait showing all family members together.

extension_activities.title: Family Gratitude Circle
extension_activities.description: Sit in a circle and take turns saying one thing they love about each family member.

extension_activities.title: Family Hug Time
extension_activities.description: Give everyone in the family extra special hugs to show appreciation.
